attributes.comment:
I am very concerned about the proposed increase in the application fee for U.S.
citizenship. I have the privilege of working with elderly refugees and immigrants,
whose dearest hope is to become a citizen. For many of them they have had to
leave behind family and culture, and yet they are so grateful to be here, free and
safe from harm. I am grateful as well, for coming to know these elderly
immigrants -- many of them persons of integrity and wisdom. Without them our
local community would be a poorer place.
For elderly immigrants the citizenship fee as it is poses a signifcant barrier. I have
met a 78 year-old woman who has resided in the United States for 16 years, and
yet she remains a non-citizen, in large part because she cannot afford the fee.
Please reconsider your proposal to raise the citizenship application fee. As
William Youmans of Catholic Legal Immigration Network writes, "The United
States is an immigrant naton which is strengthened by the contributions of
newcomers of all backgrounds. Raising the obstacles to integration goes against
this proud legacy."
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Judith Southworth
